result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric L. CIHA was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conscutive to the prison sentence presently being served on count 1 of 16 CF 259, to commence upon defendant's discharge date after extended supervision ends.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain fulltime employment or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Defendant is to comply with all child support orders and pay current and past support as ordered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric L. CIHA

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Sentencing After Revocation held on 12/10/2021
Amending credit to 171 days.
Directive from Judge Rohrer to amend JOC to indicate 171 days of credit.
Letters from DAI staff to Court regarding various subjects
Notice of Case Status Change and Discharge from DOC indicating that defendant was revoked and sentenced to prison effective 12-10-21.

3:05 PM Defendant Eric L. CIHA appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael Ross Blum appeared in court for Eric L. CIHA, Attorney Jacalyn Labre appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.
Probation has been revoked effective 08-18-2021. The defendant is now before the court for sentencing. 
The Court, state and defense have reviewed the revocation packet and there are no additions or corrections. 
The Court gives the parties 30 days to make written submissions regarding credit. 
The defendant is sentenced to the Wisconsin State Prison System for 3.5 years. Eighteen (18) months initial confinement followed by two (2) years extended supervision. 
The defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program but not the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
The court adopts 148 days sentence credit. Any additional credit should be submitted to the court in 30 days. 
The conditions of extended supervision are identical to the original probation conditions.
Minutes.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 10, 2021 at 03:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 10, 2021 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 14, 2021 at 02:30 pm.
to Convert to E-File
Michael Blum through Public Defender
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 21, 2021 at 09:00 am.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matter is continued for initial appearance on 04-11-2016 at 2:30 p.m., Br. 1.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 cash with the condition that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
